carousel.quote: A healthy mother is the heartbeat of a healthy family, and every safe birth is a promise for the future.
carousel.quoteSource: â€” Inspired by WHO Maternal Health Principles

home.aboutParagraph1: The Maternal Health Monitoring System is a comprehensive digital platform designed to monitor and support pregnant women throughout their pregnancy journey. This system ensures safe motherhood by providing continuous care, risk assessment, and timely interventions. It is a project developed at Dwarkadas J. Sanghvi College of Engineering, aiming to reduce maternal and infant mortality rates through innovative technology.
home.aboutParagraph2: Our platform integrates advanced healthcare delivery systems to provide seamless care from registration to post-delivery care. Every pregnant woman is tracked through standardized protocols ensuring no one is left behind. The system leverages digital health records, real-time monitoring, and comprehensive health program integration to maximize impact.
home.objective1: Universal registration and tracking of all pregnancies
home.objective2: Early identification and management of high-risk cases
home.objective3: Ensuring timely ANC visits and immunizations
home.objective4: Facilitating access to health programs and benefits
home.objective5: Empowering healthcare workers with digital tools
home.importantNotice1: All pregnant women are advised to register within the first trimester for optimal care and to avail maximum benefits under health programs.
home.importantNotice2: Regular ANC visits are mandatory for monitoring maternal and fetal health. Missing appointments may result in complications.
home.registrationStep1Desc: Visit your nearest ANC/PHC center with required documents
home.registrationStep2Desc: Fill comprehensive registration form with medical history
home.registrationStep3Desc: Begin regular ANC visits and continuous health monitoring
home.whyMattersDesc: Maternal health monitoring is crucial for ensuring the safety and well-being of mothers and their babies. Here's why it matters:
home.whyMatters1: India accounts for nearly 15% of global maternal deaths, but monitoring can prevent most complications.
home.whyMatters2: Early detection of high-risk pregnancies reduces maternal and infant mortality rates by up to 50%.
home.whyMatters3: Regular ANC visits and digital tracking improve birth outcomes and reduce emergency interventions.
home.whyMatters4: Comprehensive health programs and digital records ensure no mother is left behind, even in remote areas.
home.whyMatters5: Empowered healthcare workers can provide timely, targeted care with real-time data.
home.registrationTip1: Double-check all required fields before submitting the form.
home.registrationTip2: Keep your Aadhaar and medical documents handy for quick entry.
home.registrationTip3: Use a valid mobile number for important health updates.
home.registrationTip4: Contact your local ANC/PHC center for any registration help.
home.didYouKnow1: Maternal deaths in India have dropped by 70% in the last two decades with better monitoring.
home.didYouKnow2: Women with regular ANC visits are 3x more likely to have safe deliveries.
home.didYouKnow3: Digital health records help doctors spot risks early and save lives.
home.didYouKnow4: Health program support covers most costs for registered mothers.

newsTicker.label: LATEST UPDATES
newsTicker.item1: New maternal health guidelines released by health authorities
newsTicker.item2: Free iron and folic acid tablets available at all PHCs
newsTicker.item3: Maternal health benefits increased for rural areas
newsTicker.item4: Mobile health units launched in remote districts
newsTicker.item5: Digital health cards now available for pregnant women

noticeTicker.label: IMPORTANT NOTICES
noticeTicker.item1: All ANC registrations must be completed within first trimester
noticeTicker.item2: Mandatory COVID-19 vaccination for pregnant women above 18 years
noticeTicker.item3: New ultrasound facilities available at district hospitals
noticeTicker.item4: High-risk pregnancy cases to be referred to tertiary care centers
noticeTicker.item5: Monthly iron deficiency screening mandatory for all registered cases

register.error: There was an error submitting the registration. Please try again.

about.headerSubtitle: A comprehensive digital platform developed by the team of Dwarkadas J. Sanghvi College of Engineering to ensure safe motherhood and reduce maternal mortality through systematic tracking and quality healthcare delivery.
about.projectOverviewP1: The Maternal Health Monitoring System is an innovative project developed at Dwarkadas J. Sanghvi College of Engineering, designed to provide comprehensive care to pregnant women from conception to post-delivery. This digital platform ensures that every pregnancy is monitored, tracked, and supported through evidence-based interventions.
about.projectOverviewP2: Developed as part of our commitment to leveraging technology for social impact, this system integrates with existing healthcare infrastructure to provide seamless care delivery. The project represents the culmination of extensive research, development, and collaboration between computer science and healthcare domains.
about.projectOverviewP3: The platform serves as a bridge between pregnant women, healthcare providers, and health programs, ensuring that no woman is left without proper maternal care regardless of her socio-economic status or geographical location. This student initiative demonstrates the power of technology in addressing real-world healthcare challenges.
about.feature1Desc: Complete maternal health profile with medical history, risk factors, and demographic information
about.feature2Desc: Continuous tracking of pregnancy progress with automated alerts for high-risk cases
about.feature3Desc: AI-powered risk prediction algorithms to identify and manage high-risk pregnancies
about.feature4Desc: Standardized protocols and quality metrics to ensure consistent care delivery
about.headOfficeAddress: Dwarkadas J. Sanghvi College of Engineering, Mumbai
about.collegePartnershipDesc: This project is proudly developed by the team of Dwarkadas J. Sanghvi College of Engineering, demonstrating our institution's commitment to using technology for social impact and healthcare innovation.
collegeFeatures: Advanced AI/ML algorithms for risk prediction
about.academicExcellenceDesc: This project showcases the technical expertise and innovative thinking of our team, combining computer science principles with healthcare domain knowledge to create a meaningful impact on maternal health outcomes.
about.researchInnovationDesc: The development process involved extensive research in maternal health protocols, machine learning algorithms, and user experience design. Our students collaborated with healthcare professionals to ensure the system meets real-world requirements.
about.futureVisionDesc: We envision expanding this system to serve more communities and integrating additional healthcare features. The project serves as a foundation for future healthcare technology innovations from our institution.

department.title: Computer Engineering Department
department.description: This project is developed by the Computer Engineering Department at Dwarkadas J. Sanghvi College of Engineering, showcasing our expertise in software development, artificial intelligence, and healthcare technology integration.

features.aiml: Advanced AI/ML algorithms for risk prediction

academic.title: Academic Impact
academic.description: This project showcases the technical expertise and innovative thinking of our team, combining computer science principles with healthcare domain knowledge to create meaningful impact on maternal health outcomes.

schemes.title: Maternal Health Programs
schemes.subtitle: Comprehensive list of health programs and initiatives supporting maternal and child health

jsy.name: Janani Suraksha Yojana (JSY)
jsy.description: Cash assistance to pregnant women for institutional delivery
jsy.benefits: â‚¹1,400 for rural areas, â‚¹1,000 for urban areas
jsy.eligibility: BPL families, SC/ST women, women above 19 years

pmmvy.name: Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana (PMMVY)
pmmvy.description: Maternity benefit program providing cash incentives
pmmvy.benefits: â‚¹5,000 in three installments during pregnancy and post-delivery
pmmvy.eligibility: Pregnant and lactating mothers for first living child

jssk.name: Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram (JSSK)
jssk.description: Free delivery and treatment services for pregnant women
jssk.benefits: Free delivery, C-section, treatment of sick newborns
jssk.eligibility: All pregnant women delivering in public health facilities

rbsk.name: Rashtriya Bal Swasthya Karyakram (RBSK)
rbsk.description: Child health screening and early intervention services
rbsk.benefits: Free screening for 4 'D's - Defects, Diseases, Deficiencies, Disabilities
rbsk.eligibility: All children from birth to 18 years

pmsma.name: Pradhan Mantri Surakshit Matritva Abhiyan (PMSMA)
pmsma.description: Fixed day approach for comprehensive ANC
pmsma.benefits: Free ANC checkups on 9th of every month
pmsma.eligibility: All pregnant women in their 2nd and 3rd trimester

laqshya.name: LaQshya - Labour Room Quality Improvement Initiative
laqshya.description: Improving quality of care in labour rooms and maternity OTs
laqshya.benefits: Quality assured delivery services, reduced maternal mortality
laqshya.eligibility: All women delivering in participating facilities

step1.title: Step 1: Registration
step1.description: Register at your nearest ANM/ASHA worker or health facility

step2.title: Step 2: Documentation
step2.description: Provide required documents (Aadhaar, BPL card, etc.)

step3.title: Step 3: Follow-up
step3.description: Attend regular ANC visits and follow prescribed guidelines

importantInfo.title: Important Information
importantInfo.point1: All schemes are implemented through the National Health Mission (NHM)
importantInfo.point2: Benefits are directly transferred to beneficiary bank accounts
importantInfo.point3: Registration should be done as early as possible during pregnancy
importantInfo.point4: For queries, contact your local ASHA worker or PHC
